news_header: Italy, Denmark, and the Netherlands held a meeting to discuss innovative solutions for migration, focusing on asylum policies and potential repatriation centers.
news_text: A coordination meeting hosted by Italy, Denmark, and the Netherlands addressed innovative solutions to combat migration, particularly focusing on differing views among EU member states regarding asylum policies. Polish Minister Donald Tusk highlighted concerns over asylum seekers from Belarus, while Finnish Prime Minister Petteri Orpo supported EU-level legislation to manage migration. The meeting included discussions on repatriation centers for asylum seekers and an agreement between Italy and Albania for the reception of asylum seekers. The meeting aimed to align member states on migration strategies and was attended by various EU ministers and the European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, who expressed support for the proposed return centers. Leaders agreed to reconvene before the next European Council meeting.
